name: dissoluble
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
able to be dissolved (= ended): It is wrong to argue that divorce legislation defines all marriages as being dissoluble. The Council had no autonomy, was established by presidential decree, and was dissoluble by the president.
old use or not standard able to be dissolved to form a solution (= a liquid into which a solid has been mixed and has dissolved): One common property of a salt was that it was easily dissoluble in water. The paper proposes a new physical-chemical coupling method using dissoluble saline barriers. Synonym
soluble
More examplesFewer examplesAt that time, engagements to be married were dissoluble by mutual consent of the parties. The bond between the dog and his master was not dissoluble.
